member.name: T:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoColor
member.summary: The GoColor structure represents a color in five different color models, RGB, CMY, CMYK, HSB, and HSL. Each of the components of the color models can be modified to change the represented color.
member.remarks: There are a number of static (shared) methods to easily construct a GoColor from a System.Drawing.Color or from color values in the different color models.

member.returns: Returns true if the specified System.Object is equal to the current Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoColor, otherwise, returns false.

member.name: T:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoColorCollection
member.summary: The GoColorCollection class represents a collection of mappings between Strings and GoColor structures. From String to GoColor, the mapping is a one-to-one relationship. In other words, each String maps to one and only one GoColor structure. From GoColor to String, the mapping is a many-to-one relationship. In other words, each GoColor structure can map to multiple Strings. The GoColorCollection accepts GoColor structures with null String values. In this case, the GoColor is added to the collection without a mapping a String object. However, null will not map to GoColor structures without String associations.

member.summary: Adds a GoColor structure associated with the specified name to the colleciton.
member.param: The GoColor structure to add to the collection.

member.name: T:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoPropertyModifierPart
member.summary: Distinguish between different parts of property values that are themselves complex objects.

remarks.para: This enumeration helps distinguish multiple properties of a single GoObject property value, such as the color of a GoShape.Brush or the width of a GoListGroup.BorderPen. Currently defined are only properties of brushes and pens.

These part specifiers are ignored for most GoObject properties, since those property values are simple values, such as booleans, enumerations, floating-point numbers, strings, or Colors, and hence do not have parts that could be set separately.
Although this enumeration helps distinguish subproperties of a , you still need to identify the actual property, using an integer that is a . subhint, as used by ..

member.summary: This class is used to pass search arguments to the various Find... and Modify... methods of , including and .

remarks.para:
The standard information needed to determine the property and to choose which s to consider are:
an integer, this identifies the particular property by using the . value that should uniquely identify a property for a particular object class.
a , this identifies a particular part of the given property for those property values that have parts that could be set independently.
a , this identifies which s to consider.
If you want to customize the chosen objects and properties, you may inherit from this class to add your own information to be used by overrides of the Find... and Modify... methods of .

member.summary: This event occurs just after a property is changed.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical or horizontal display orientation of the ruler.
member.value: The default value is Orientation.Horizontal: the ruler measures from left to right
member.remarks: The Orientation property determines how the interval marks are drawn onto the ruler. If the Orientation is Orientation.Horizontal, then the marks are drawn vertically. If the Orientation is Orientation.Vertical, then the marks are drawn horizontally.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.TextOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the text on the ruler.
member.remarks: The TextOrientation determines the rotation of the text when it is drawn onto the ruler. GoRulerTextOrientation.Normal represents a rotation of zero degrees, GoRulerTextOrientation.TopDown represents a rotation of 90 degrees, GoRulerTextOrientation.UpsideDown represents a rotation of 180 degrees, and GoRulerTextOrientation.UpsideDown represents a rotation of 270 degrees.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.TextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the text on the ruler.
member.remarks: The TextAlignment property determines the position of the text around each interval mark. Note that when the ruler is short/narrow, there might not be much difference in the vertical positioning of the text. Furthermore, because of how text is drawn with some spacing above and below the glyphs, the text may appear to be centered in a suprising manner.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.TextFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string to use for formatting the measurement value.
member.value: By default this is just "{0:G}", formatting the double-precision floating point value as a general number.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.BorderStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the border style of the ruler.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.Border3DStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the 3D border style of the ruler.
member.remarks: The Border3DStyle property is dependent on the . If the value of is BorderStyle.Fixed3D, then the border of the control is drawn using the value of the property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.Units
member.summary: Gets or sets the units that the ruler is measuring in.
member.remarks: determines how the lines will be drawn onto the control.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.Marks
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of s to use when drawing the intervals onto the ruler.
member.value: The initial value is an array of four s. They draw 100%, 60%, 40%, and 30% across. Only the first one has set to true.

remarks.p: The Marks property determines the maximum amount of intervals will be shown on the ruler at any given time. Each in the array determines how each interval mark will be drawn on the ruler.
If Marks is null or contains no elements (Marks.Length == 0), then no interval marks will be drawn onto the ruler.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.Intervals
member.summary: Gets or sets the array of intervals of measurement for the ruler.
member.remarks: When setting the property, elements in the array are sorted in decending order. For example, if the value of Intervals was set to {100, 10, 1, 0.1}, then the ruler would be divided every 100 units, 10 units, 1 unit, and tenths of a unit. All of the marks at the specified intervals may not be visible at one time. The visibility of the marks representing the intervals depends on the the number of Intervals, the number of specified, and the DocScale. If Intervals is null or contains no elements (Intervals.Length == 0), then no interval marks will be drawn onto the ruler

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.StartValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value at which the ruler starts measuring.
member.remarks: The StartValue property is where the ruler begins measurement. The value of StartValue is in the current .

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.EndValue
member.summary: Gets the measurement value at the visible end of the ruler.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.DocStartValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the of the ruler using document units instead of the ruler's current units.

remarks.p: The DocStartValue property converts the value from document units to or from the ruler's current .
This value is normally kept in sync with a GoView's DocPosition property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.WorldScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the measurement scale ratio for the ruler.
member.value: The default value is 1.0f; the value must be greater than zero.

remarks.p: The WorldScale property is useful for displaying measurements on a variety of different scales. For example, when the WorldScale is set to a value of 0.5, then every Unit displayed on the ruler is half size. When the WorldScale is set to a value of 2.0, then every Unit displayed appears twice as large as normal.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.DocScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the document scale ratio for the ruler (Zoom).
member.value: The default value is 1.0f; the value must be greater than zero.

remarks.p: The DocScale property is useful for zooming. For example, when the DocScale is set to a value of 0.5, the ruler will display measurements at %50 of their normal size. When the DocScale is set to a value of 2.0, the ruler will display measurements at %200 of their normal size.
This value is normally kept in sync with a GoView's DocScale property.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.ReverseDirection
member.summary: Gets of sets the direction in which the ruler is measuring.
member.remarks: If ReverseDirection is set to true, the direction of measurement is reversed. For example, if negative infinity were toward the left and positive infinity were toward the right, after setting the value of ReverseDirection to true, negative infinity is now toward the right and positive infinity is now toward the left.

member.name: P:Northwoods.Go.Draw.GoRuler.ShowsNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the numbers on the ruler.

member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of the s on the ruler.

member.summary: Provides a user interface for editing the bold, italic, strikethough, underline, auto resizes, bordered, multiline, and wrapping properties of a GoText object in a Form, either as a modal dialog or as a modeless form.

remarks.para: A typical use is to create an instance of this GoTextForm, assign the (a ) so that this control knows which to consider, and assign the value so that this control knows which objects to modify.
